definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to spend the whole day eating (i.e. not doing any work)
to be unable to carry on even for a single day/to be in a desperate situation
to eat three square meals a day and do no work (idiom)/to be sated with food and remain idle
pinyin: bao3 shi2 zhong1 ri4 , wu2 suo3 yong4 xin1

sentences.english: That perverse guy has been nagging at me all day.
sentences.chinese: 那個故意與我作對的傢伙讓我終日不得安寧。

sentences.english: After her shoplifting spree she lived in mortal dread of being found out.
sentences.chinese: 在商店連番行竊之後，她惶恐終日，害怕給人發現。

sentences.english: They rejoice in your name all day long; they exult in your righteousness.
sentences.chinese: 他們因你的名終日歡樂，因你的公義得以高舉。

sentences.english: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
sentences.chinese: 他們因你的名終日歡樂，因你的公義得以高舉。

sentences.english: Poly apes sometimes birds, empty all day Wind and Smoke.
sentences.chinese: 有時聚猿鳥，終日空風煙。

sentences.english: His roommate’s bed was tightly close to the window, while he could only lie in bed all day long.
sentences.chinese: 病友的牀緊靠着窗，而他只能終日平躺在牀上。

sentences.english: All day long I have been plagued; I have been punished every morning.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我終日遭災難，每早晨受懲治。

sentences.english: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
sentences.chinese: 我們爲你的緣故終日被殺，人看我們如將宰的羊。

sentences.english: I spent day after day in the direst suspense.
sentences.chinese: 我終日在憂心忡忡中度過。

sentences.english: From then on he just sat silently all day long, facing the wall, practicing "wall contemplation; "Perhaps he was waiting for someone.
sentences.chinese: 從此面壁而坐，終日默默修煉，也許他在等待着誰。

sentences.english: And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.
sentences.chinese: 我的舌頭，要終日論說你的公義，時常讚美你。

sentences.english: Rest for the whole day next day, my head feels a bit heavy.
sentences.chinese: 至曉，回營休息終日，頭略覺沉重。

sentences.english: My tongue will speak of your righteousness and of your praises all day long.
sentences.chinese: 我的舌頭，要終日論說你的公義，時常讚美你。

sentences.english: No surprise there are worst consults all the time.
sentences.chinese: 腫瘤科沒有意外，最壞的事終日產生。

sentences.english: Better starve free than be a fat slave.
sentences.chinese: 捱餓而擁有自由，勝過飽食終日的奴隸。

sentences.english: What is this life if, full of care.
sentences.chinese: 終日營營的生活會是怎樣？

definition: to turn upside down/to reverse/back to front/confused/deranged/crazy
to pay no attention to/to disregard/to ignore/to let go unpunished/to let off
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)
variant of 流連|流连[liu2 lian2]
to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
